hbonds.py¶

Use geometric criteria to identify hydrogen bonds

usage: hbonds.py [-h] [-t TRAJ] [-g GRO] [-p TOP] [-b BEGIN] [-e END]
                 [-sk SKIP] [-r RESIDUES [RESIDUES ...]]
                 [-a ATOMS [ATOMS ...]] [-d DISTANCE] [-angle ANGLE_CUT]
                 [-xlink] [-xtop XLINK_TOPOLOGY] [-xres XLINK_RESIDUE]
                 [-l LOAD] [-acc ACCEPTORS [ACCEPTORS ...]]
                 [-donors DONORS [DONORS ...]] [-s SAVENAME]

Named Arguments¶

-t, –traj

Path to input file

Default: “wiggle.trr”

-g, –gro

Coordinate file

Default: “wiggle.gro”

-p, –top

Gromacs topology file

Default: “topol.top”

-b, –begin

End frame

Default: 0

-e, –end

Start frame

Default: -1

-sk, –skip

Skip every skip frames

Default: 1

-r, –residues

Residues to include in h-bond search

Default: [‘HII’]

-a, –atoms Atoms to include for each residue. Each list of atoms must be passed with a separate -a flag for each residue inargs.residues
-d, –distance

Maximum distance between acceptor and donor atoms

Default: 0.3

-angle, –angle_cut
 

Maximum DHA angle to be considered an H-bond

Default: 20

-xlink, –xlink
 

Specify if system is cross-linked sincethe topology will be set up

Default: False

-xtop, –xlink_topology
 

Name of .itp file which describes cross-linked residue

Default: “assembly.itp”

-xres, –xlink_residue
 

Name of residue in molecules section of the topology corresponding to args.xlink_topology

Default: “HII”

-l, –load

Load pickled system object

Default: False

-acc, –acceptors
 

If you only want hbonds with acceptoratoms of a residue, use this flag. 1 for this condition, otherwise 0. Input as a list of 0 and 1 in the same order as args.residues

Default: False

-donors, –donors
 

If you only want hbonds with donoratoms of a residue, use this flag. 1 for this condition, otherwise 0. Input as a list of 0 and 1 in the same order as args.residues

Default: False

-s, –savename

Name of pickled object to save aftercalcualtions are complete

Default: “hbonds.pl”
